image.altText: A selfie of Leannedra Kang and Takahiro Toya with a view of Hobart below them

props.synopsis: Police have discovered a crashed car and what are believed to be the bodies of tourists Leannedra Kang and Takahiro Toya two days after the couple were due home in Queensland.

title.children: Tasmanian police find bodies in search for missing Queensland couple

image.altText: Two politicians speak at a press conference

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Liberals have walked away from hopes to sell off some state-owned companies to pay down debt.

title.children: 'No privatisation': Tasmanian government rules out asset sales

image.altText: A woman with dark hair embraces a man in a suit with a solemn expression outside a red brick building.

props.synopsis: The atmosphere in the Devonport Magistrates Court was tense as Magistrate Robert Webster announced Rosemary Gamble was not guilty in the only criminal case to come from the Hillcrest Primary School jumping castle tragedy.

title.children: 'Broken' families tell of anger and disappointment following Hillcrest verdict

image.altText: Jeremy Rockliff with a football.

props.synopsis: Does Tasmania have a government? Has the AFL team crumbled before it even started? The big stadium project, has that fallen over too? Yes, it has been a chaotic 72 hours — let's try to explain what just happened.

title.children: What just happened in Tasmanian politics? Let's try to explain

image.altText: Composite image Jeremy Rockliff and Dean Winter.

props.synopsis: The toppling of Tasmania's premier has drawn strong reactions from across Australia. Some are calling it a "fiasco" while others say the turmoil has turned the state into the nation's "laughing stock".

title.children: Australia reacts to Tasmanian political 'clown show'

image.altText: Man stands and looks off camera

props.synopsis: Longer dry spells and higher intensity rainfall when it does rain — farmers are adapting to changing climate patterns.

title.children: Cattle to wine grapes: Climate change forcing Tasmanian farmers to pivot

image.altText: Close-up of Tasmania Devils AFL team foundation jumper design.

props.synopsis: As political turmoil continues to engulf Tasmania, the Devils AFL team remains at high risk of becoming collateral damage.

title.children: What will happen to Tasmania's AFL team? Depends on who you ask

image.altText: Slices of body parts covered in Perspex and put on display on walls.

props.synopsis:
Can you imagine finding out the remains of a loved one might have become part of a museum collection to be used for scientific research?

That's what happened to a Tasmanian man whose two year old daughter died suddenly in the 1980's ... but he's only just made the grim discovery.

title.children: Tassie's dark side of so-called scientifc research.

image.altText: Crash Body by Paula Garcia

props.synopsis: Tasmania's iconic winter festival gets underway today, with free experiences hidden across Hobart in disused churches, basements and even a Freemasons lodge.

title.children: Where to find free art as 'behemoth' Dark Mofo festival kicks off

image.altText: Ange Postecoglou in a Spurs tracksuit following a Premier League match.

props.synopsis: Tottenham Hotspur's decision to sack coach Ange Postecoglou sparks sympathy and outrage as the football world digests the news of the Australian's departure from the English Premier League club.

title.children: 'Absolutely bonkers': Spurs face backlash over Postecoglou sacking

image.altText: A satellite image shows three destroyed aircraft sitting on a tarmac that runs between verdants strips of grass and trees.

props.synopsis: Vladimir Putin's online army is normally supportive, but some accounts have been boldly outspoken and willing to question, even blame, the Russian establishment for not protecting the country's prized strategic bomber fleet.

title.children: As Russian planes burned, Putin's military bloggers were 'choking with hurt'

image.altText: Priya sign

props.synopsis: The federal government has promised to close the loophole that allowed employers to cancel paid parental leave after a stillbirth or early infant death.

title.children: Law to change after mother's paid parental leave cancelled when baby died

image.altText: A couple hold up peace signs to the camera.

props.synopsis: Across China, a growing number of young heterosexual women are fed up with traditional pressures around marriage and sexism and choosing to stay single.

title.children: China's falling birth rate meets a #boysober dating revolution

image.altText: Donald Trump holding tariff sign with beef

props.synopsis: The beef trade between Australia and the United States is currently a one-way street. That's unlikely to change.

title.children: Demand for Aussie beef outweighs Trump tariffs

image.altText: An old building with blue mesh fencing around it and trees

props.synopsis: Derelict Queensland island resorts that were once playgrounds for the rich and famous are facing a state government takeover, amid frustrations they have been used for land banking.

title.children: From celebrity hideaway to feral goats: What's next for these island resorts?

image.altText: A young girl lies with her head down in front of flower tributes.

props.synopsis: Who could investigate Kumanjayi White's death? Calls are growing for an independent probe into the death of the young Aboriginal man — but who could it be handed to?

title.children: 'Hand it to Vic police': Calls for Kumanjayi White's death to be investigated interstate

image.altText: Jannik Sinner applauds the French open crowd.

props.synopsis: World number one Jannik Sinner will face defending champion Carlos Alcaraz in the French Open final after defeating Novak Djokovic in straight sets.

title.children: Sinner beats Djokovic to set up French Open final against Alcaraz

image.altText: School building with red open sign out the front of it

props.synopsis: When Geranium Primary School was forced to close its doors due to dwindling enrolment numbers, it shut a century-old chapter for the tiny town. But then one former teacher with big dreams stepped in to her help her town blossom again.

title.children: Town of 80 buys old primary school for $1.10 and turns it into op shop

image.altText: Blurry vehicles including a bus drive past a dead wombat on its side on the side of the road.

props.synopsis: These fence posts are connected only by a sensor but advocates say they could reduce roadkill incidents by 90 per cent.

title.children: The $10,000 per kilometre solution to roadkill

image.altText: A soccer ball with the words "A Leagues 2024/25" printed on it sits on grass, viewed through a large, ring-shaped metal trophy.

props.synopsis: Football Australia is being investigated over its ability to protect the sport’s integrity amid the A-League’s second match-fixing scandal in 12 months.

title.children: Football Australia facing integrity probe amid second match-fixing scandal

image.altText: The entrance to CS Square shopping centre, with a pedestrian crossing out the front.

props.synopsis: A group of males armed with machetes have argued inside shopping centre in Melbourne's west, prompting a police investigation.

title.children: Second machete incident sends Melbourne shopping centre into lockdown

image.altText: Kilmar Abrego Garcia wears a black t-shirt and Chicago Bulls cap.

props.synopsis: US Attorney-General Pam Bondi says Kilmar Abrego Garcia, who was mistakenly deported to El Salvador, has returned to the United States to face criminal charges.

title.children: Man mistakenly deported to El Salvador returns to US to face criminal charges

image.altText: A cream coloured building with a sign reading ‘Al Azhar University Gaza’ surrounded by rubble.

props.synopsis: Palestinian academics who fled Gaza after the war say a "generation of students" has been lost due to the conflict.

title.children: How Gaza has 'lost a generation' of students

image.altText: A group of punks wearing Dr Martens milling on a street corner

props.synopsis: Dr Martens, known for its punk roots, released its financial forecast on Friday amid concerns the brand may be on the brink.

title.children: The financial fall of anti-capitalist icon Dr Martens

image.altText: A woman looks into the distance with a sad face

props.synopsis: A retired nurse who lost money in a Byron Bay real estate fraud case vows to be in court when the agent is sentenced, after she was ordered to return to Australia from the United States.

title.children: Woman who lost money to fraud wants to look real estate agent 'in the eye'

image.altText: The Pitt HBO max

props.synopsis: If you have had the unfortunate need to turn up to an emergency department, I hope that it is not because in Australia in 2025, you can't afford to go anywhere else.

title.children: 'It's absolutely true': Australian emergency room doctor watches The Pitt

image.altText: A group of young girls in Christmas-themed costumes play string instruments amongst bails of hay.

props.synopsis: A North Queensland council is slashing its contributions to volunteer-run events 12 months after raising rates and parking fees.

title.children: Events cop funding hit as Queensland council wields budget axe

image.altText: A woman wearing a purple jacket stands in front of art work

props.synopsis: Whilst some of her predecessors have enjoyed decades-long tenures, the gallery's new director is determined not to waste a moment.

title.children: New gallery boss weighs in on dumped artist controversy

image.altText: A tornado near Ballarat in Victoria in 2007.

props.synopsis: Most people associate tornadoes with the United States, but as many as 80 touch down in Australia each year.

title.children: Australia has up to 80 tornadoes a year, but many go unseen

image.altText: blurred man standing in front of tobacco store with price list in focus

props.synopsis: An insurance broker says it has become "almost impossible" to find cover for stores that sell tobacco products after they've become a target for arson in the past year.

title.children: Tobacconists struggling to get cover as insurers 'turn off the tap'

image.altText: A machine in a vineyard emits light from panels.

props.synopsis: Wine grape growers grappling with declining sales and rising expenses hope advancements in autonomous technology can help safeguard the industry.

title.children: Robots roll out as grape growers struggle with disease, rising costs

image.altText: A woman in a yellow t-shirt throws a ball into a black space.

props.synopsis: Australian Diamond and Super Netball player Cara Koenen had her existence rocked after becoming a victim of gendered violence. She lost confidence on court and struggled to sleep. She's telling her story in the hope it'll raise awareness of the major health and welfare issue in Australia.

title.children: 'I had an experience that rocked my world': Super Netball player Cara Koenen on violence against women

image.altText: Andre 3000 wearing a prop piano strapped to his back, a red hat and a dark suit

props.synopsis: They're in films, cartoons, Olympic Games and even on red carpets. How many of these piano pop culture references do you know in our quiz?

title.children: Film to fashion, how well do you know your pianos in pop culture?

image.altText: Two women embrace, standing against a black background. They have serious expressions and both wear saris.

props.synopsis: India's Narmada River was the lifeblood of countless farmers and villages until a dam project caused a massive ecological disaster. It's now the subject of a new Australian play.

title.children: Up to 500,000 Indians were displaced by a dam. Their story is now a play
